summary: An email forwarded within an organization, containing a message from Maria F Suarez Landoll claiming to be the grandson of a former housekeeper for Jeffrey Epstein. The message states the housekeeper took memory cards, pictures, videos, and audio tapes from Epstein's Manhattan house when fired, and that the family is being threatened by Epstein's lawyers to return the material. The sender claims to have offered the material to ABC and Fox News, and seeks to provide it without monetary compensation.

persons.role: Email sender, grandson of former Epstein housekeeper
persons.context: Claims to be the English-speaking grandson of a woman who worked as a housekeeper for Jeffrey Epstein in Manhattan and took hidden memory cards, pictures, videos, and audio tapes when she was fired. He is attempting to provide this material to news organizations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The former employer of the housekeeper. The hidden material (pictures, videos, audio tapes) was allegedly taken from his Manhattan house.

persons.name: Mark Remillard
persons.context: An individual at ABC News who provided contact information and was hesitant to receive the alleged material due to its content.

persons.name: Mr Indieke
persons.context: Named, along with Mr. Cann, as a lawyer threatening the sender's family to hand over the material taken from Epstein's house.

persons.name: Mr Cann
persons.context: Named, along with Mr. Indieke, as a lawyer threatening the sender's family to hand over the material taken from Epstein's house.

events.title: Housekeeper Employment at Epstein's Manhattan House
events.description: A woman in her 60s worked as a housekeeper at Jeffrey Epstein's house in Manhattan.

events.title: Housekeeper Fired and Takes Material
events.description: On the day she was fired, the housekeeper took memory cards, pictures, video tapes, and audio tapes she had found hidden in Epstein's Manhattan house.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Hidden Material
events.description: Maria F Suarez Landoll sends an email claiming possession of the material, stating the family is being threatened by Epstein's lawyers, and that news organizations (ABC, Fox News) have been contacted.

locations: Colombia (location of the sender and where Fox News verified material)
keyFacts: A former housekeeper for Jeffrey Epstein allegedly took hidden memory cards, pictures, videos, and audio tapes from his Manhattan house when she was fired between 2012 and 2017.
The housekeeper's grandson, Maria F Suarez Landoll, claims the family is being threatened by Epstein's lawyers, Mr. Indieke and Mr. Cann, to return the material.
The material was allegedly offered to ABC News (Mark Remillard) and Fox News, with Fox News reportedly verifying its authenticity through a correspondent in Colombia.
The sender explicitly states the material contains child pornography and that they are not seeking monetary compensation, only to provide the material.
